testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlNodeStatusRequest dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.4.2.1 [Need to Share Node State] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Node Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.4.2.2.5.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N13R247_Restrictions___Node_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N13R247_Restrictions___Node_Status_Supported}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Roadway Network Name - Node Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.4.2.2.5.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N13R248_Roadway_Network_Name___Node_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N13R248_Roadway_Network_Name___Node_Status_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Node Name - Node Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.4.2.2.5.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N13R249_Node_Name___Node_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N13R249_Node_Name___Node_Status_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Node Status Date and Time Change Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.4.2.2.5.2.4). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N13R250_Node_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N13R250_Node_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Define the message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: RequestMessage: ${RequestMessage}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}

Step 9 REQUEST-RESPONSE-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlNodeStatusRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N13R241_Send_Node_Status_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter REQUESTMESSAGE = RequestMessage ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected
Step 10 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.1 VERIFY that element nodeStatusMsg exists.
Step 10.2 VERIFY that element organization-information exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item
Step 10.3 VERIFY that element network-id exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.4 VERIFY that element node-id exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.5 VERIFY that element node-status exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.6 IF TMDD_N13R247_Restrictions___Node_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.6.1 VERIFY that element restrictions exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item
Step 10.7 IF TMDD_N13R248_Roadway_Network_Name___Node_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.7.1 VERIFY that element network-name exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.8 IF TMDD_N13R249_Node_Name___Node_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.8.1 VERIFY that element node-name exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.9 IF TMDD_N13R250_Node_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.9.1 VERIFY that element last-update-time exists within each instance of nodeStatusMsg.node-status-item.node-status-list.node
Step 10.10 VERIFY that the values within the RESPONSE message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content
